page.title: 08The Louth Educational System
page.content: The 4 Louth plan secondary schools (Monks' Dyke,Cordeaux,John Birkbeck,King Edward 6) together form a 2412 pupil unit serving the Louth/North Somercotes area.Pupils enter at 11+.The 3 high schools cater for all 11_14 year olds.Provision for years 4_5 is made jointly by the 4 schools,each having a different curriculum.After careful consideration a committee of heads determine the most appropriate school for each pupil.Sixth form provision is made by King Edward 6.Entry to the 6 form is optional.The 4 Louth plan primary schools (Kidgate,Lacey Gardens,St. Michaels,Eastfield Infants) cater for 1095 children between 4 _ 11+.Newly formed plans (due to the decreasing school population)seem to make mergers between schools probable.Major changes may be made during 1986/1987.
